required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Pilot Study Evaluating the Signs and Symptoms of Seasonal Allergic Rhinoconjunctivitis Following Exposure in the Allergen BioCube
clinical_study.official_title: A Pilot Study Evaluating the Signs and Symptoms of Seasonal Allergic Rhinitis and Conjunctivitis Following Allergen Exposure in the Allergen BioCube

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to evaluate ocular and nasal signs and symptoms in patients with seasonal allergic rhinoconjunctivitis following allergen exposure in the Allergen BioCube.

primary_outcome.time_frame: At specified timepoints for up to 3 hours
At specified timepoints for up to 3 hours

primary_outcome.measure: Total Ocular Symptom Score (TOSS)of ocular itching and redness
Total Nasal Symptom Score (TNSS) of nasal symptoms

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At specified timepoints for up to 3 hours
At specified timepoints for up to 3 hours
At specified timepoints for up to 3 hours
At specified timepoints for up to 3 hours
At specified timepoints for up to 3 hours
At specified timepoints for up to 3 hours
At specified timepoints for up to 3 hours
At specified timepoints for up to 3 hours

study_pop.textblock: Subjects will be 18 years of age or older with a positive history of ocular and nasal allergy and a positive skin test reaction to one of the allergens tested within the past 24 months
